definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: That good for nothing never sends any money to his poor mother.
sentences.chinese: 那個沒用的傢伙，從不給他可憐的母親送錢。

sentences.english: Man is the only creature that consumes without producing.
sentences.chinese: 人是一種最可憐的傢伙，什麼都產不了，只會揮霍。

sentences.english: The poor old man plods along, hardly able to lift each food.
sentences.chinese: 這可憐白勺白叟喫力地走着，幾乎都擡不動腳了。

sentences.english: A small bird will drop frozen dead from a bough without ever having felt sorry for itself.
sentences.chinese: 一隻小鳥將自枝頭凍斃跌下來他未曾爲自己感到可憐。

sentences.english: He wants to be noticed, but what's a poor fish to do?
sentences.chinese: 牠想要引起別人注意，但一隻可憐的魚又能如何？

sentences.english: The poor quarryman would have no tomb and no hope of an afterlife.
sentences.chinese: 這個可憐的採石工沒有墳墓，也不能奢望來世。

sentences.english: The poor boy made his living by selling newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 可憐的男孩靠賣報維持生活。

sentences.english: Don't be loaded , let everybody thought that you have more pitiful?
sentences.chinese: 難道是裝的，讓大家以爲你有多可憐？

sentences.english: This poor woman will go to her grave without ever achieving her goal.
sentences.chinese: 這個可憐的女人實現不了她的目標，她會自取滅亡。

sentences.english: Their main grievance was that they had not received their pitiably low pay.
sentences.chinese: 他們主要的抱怨是沒有拿到那少得可憐的工資。

sentences.english: Poor Barry stopped a packet when his car was in collision with a lorry.
sentences.chinese: 巴里的車與一輛卡車相撞，可憐的巴里身負重傷。

sentences.english: The poor priest was plied with drink at a dinner party.
sentences.chinese: 宴會上不斷有人給可憐的牧師灌酒。

sentences.english: You forgive me for being so pathetic.
The poor cat was kicked downstairs by the children.
sentences.chinese: 你折磨那隻可憐的貓真缺德。

definition: to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
